Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2008 01:09PM - edited Mar 28, 2008 01:52PM by JC858 My surgery was the same day as yours.  My pain is finally better.  It still hurts, and my arm is numb, but I am so much better. Wearing my bra constantly really helps.   Are you able to move your arm?  I am having a hard time lifting my arm over my head, and I don't have much strength in it. Does anyone know how long it takes to regain strength and mobility?
Posts.Title: Bilateral mastectomy - PAIN jeanette51 dlm425

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2008 08:11PM JC858 wrote: I developed a small, very painful seroma after my surgery. My surgeon was smart. He drained it when he knew the pain was extremely unbearable. He knew when to leave it alone. I was impressed. Wearing my bra was extremely helpful.  I experienced a lot of pain. I hope your surgeon drains it for you when needed; like someone else said, there is instant relief when it is drained.
Posts.Title: Anyone develop a seroma? Kimber 5yrsurvivor
